sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: Zend_Memory component is intended to manage memory in limited memory environment.
Memory objects (memory containers) are generated by memory manager by request and transparently swapped/loaded when it's necessary.
Memory manager uses Zend_Cache backends as storage providers.

example.title: Using Zend_Memory component
example.para: Zend_Memory::factory() instantiates memory manager object with specified backend options.
example.programlisting:
<?php
require_once 'Zend/Memory.php';

$backendOptions = array(
    'cacheDir' => './tmp/' // Directory where to put the swapped memory blocks
);

$memoryManager = Zend_Memory::factory('File', $backendOptions);

...

$loadedFiles = array();

for ($count = 0; $count < 10000; $count++) {
    $f = fopen($fileNames[$count], 'rb');
    $data = fread($f, filesize($fileNames[$count]));
    $fclose($f);

    $loadedFiles[] = $memoryManager->create($data);
}

...

echo $loadedFiles[$index1]->value;
...
$loadedFiles[$index2]->value = $newValue;
...
$loadedFiles[$index3]->value[$charIndex] = '_';
...

sect2.title: Theory of Operation
sect2.para:
Zend_Memory component operates with the following concepts:
Memory manager
Memory container
Locked memory object
Movable memory object
Memory manager generates memory objects (locked or movable) by request of user application and returns them wrapped into memory container object.
Memory container has virtual or actual value attribute of string type. It represents the value specified at memory object creation time.
Locked memory objects are always stored in memory.

Movable memory objects are transparently swapped and loaded to/from backend when it's necessary
Memory manager doesn't swap objects with size less than it's specified due to performance considerations. See Memory Manager Settings. MinSize. section for more details. .
